definitions.definition: A metric unit of mass equal to exactly 200 mg , chiefly used for measuring precious stones and pearls .
Any of several small units of mass used for measuring precious stones and pearls , equivalent to 189–212 mg .
A 24- point scale used to measure the purity of gold .
examples: 18- carat gold is 75% gold by mass. 24- carat gold is pure.

main_definition: A metric unit of mass equal to exactly 200 mg , chiefly used for measuring precious stones and pearls .

A 24- point scale used to measure the purity of gold .
